{"step_by_step_thinking": "Lipoproteins are complex particles that transport lipids in the body. According to the documents, they have a central hydrophobic core of non-polar lipids, primarily cholesteryl esters and triglycerides (B). This hydrophobic core is surrounded by a hydrophilic membrane consisting of phospholipids, free cholesterol (A), and apolipoproteins (C). Therefore, all the options A, B, and C are components of a typical lipoprotein.", "answer_choice": "D"}
